channel.title: Addition and Subtraction (Very Basic)
channel.description:
[center][u][b]Addition and Subtraction [/b][/u][/center]
[b]Basic Addition.[/b]
8+7=15
[i]How this is done?[/i] (8) More than (7) (,9,10,11,12,13,14,15) <7 numbers are there. [i]Note:[/i]You never count the number you are adding eg.8 in the first place. If you do,it will look like this which is WRONG. (8,9,10,11,12,13,14,15)Then there are 8 numbers there and it will sum up to 16 (8+8=16) But in the equation we want to find (8+7=15)
[b]Basic Subtraction.[/b] 8-7=1
[i]How this is done?[/i] There is only 1 number in the middle of 8 and 7.Like this 8-----1------7.Here is another example (11-7=4) 11---1-2--3-4--7 there are 4 numbers in the middle of that equation,so the answer is 4 for (11-7).To make this more understanding.Lets use this equation again (11-7) We will start from 8 not 7.If you start from 7 you are adding another number to the equation and we don't want that. Count (8,9,10,11) There are 4 numbers there.And that's your answer!
~MoparUnited~

item.title: Addition and Subtraction (Very Basic)
item.dc:creator: @pk4pk pk4pk
item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

[quote=“MoparUnited, post:6, topic:219789”][quote author=pk4pk link=topic=288681.msg2332228#msg2332228 date=1215937673]

Wtf? I don’t get any of it. Explain better plz.

It was kind of hard for me to understand it my self.But i’ll give it a shot to help you.What part don’t you get in that?Or what part do you want to know?

Ehh,uhhm…how does 8+7=15??
[/quote]

Okay thanks for your reply,to do that easily thanks to some wikipedia help,lets say there where 8 apples and 7 other apples
which is the same as 15 apples.
So like 3+2 3 apples and 2 apples together they make 5 apples.
Here is an image of that equation: http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/5/5c/Addition01.svg
For much better explanation please visit this site http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Addition[/quote]
LOFUCKINGL

Read full topic

item.title: Addition and Subtraction (Very Basic)
item.dc:creator: @MoparUnited MoparUnited
item.description:
@MoparUnited wrote:

[center]Addition and Subtraction [/center]

Basic Addition.

8+7=15

How this is done?
(8) More than (7) (,9,10,11,12,13,14,15) <7 numbers are there.
Note:You never count the number you are adding eg.8 in the first place. If you do,it will look like this which is WRONG.
(8,9,10,11,12,13,14,15)Then there are 8 numbers there and it will sum up to 16 (8+8=16) But in the equation we want to find (8+7=15)

Basic Subtraction.
8-7=1

How this is done?
There is only 1 number in the middle of 8 and 7.Like this 8-----1------7.Here is another example (11-7=4) 11—1-2–3-4–7 there are 4 numbers in the middle of that equation,so the answer is 4 for (11-7).To make this more understanding.Lets use this equation again (11-7)
We will start from 8 not 7.If you start from 7 you are adding another number to the equation and we don’t want that.
Count (8,9,10,11) There are 4 numbers there.And that’s your answer!

~MoparUnited~
